arm_group.description: Non Cadaveric human BellaDerm Acellular dermal tissue

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to Evaluate the efficacy and longevity of a Human-derived,
      non-cadaveric, acellular dermal implant (BellaDerm) as a posterior spacer graft in the
      correction of lower eyelid retraction, taking into consideration issues associated with the
      use of acelular dermis such as contraction and potential regression of repairs.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Outcomes Assessment of the Utility of Belladerm Acellular Dermal Allograft in Ocular Lower Lid Retraction Repair

detailed_description.textblock:
To Evaluate the efficacy and longevity of a Human-derived, non-cadaveric, acellular dermal
      implant (BellaDerm) as a posterior spacer graft in the correction of lower eyelid
      retraction, taking into consideration issues associated with the use of acelular dermis such
      as contraction and potential regression of repairs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Lower eyelid retraction, defined as inferior displacement of the lower eyelid margin
             with inferior scleral show, may be asymptomatic

          -  May have ocular irritation including foreign body sensation, burning, photophobia and
             tearing.

          -  May have aesthetically unsatisfactory eyelid appearance.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Have a condition that would be contraindicated to surgery

intervention.intervention_name: Non Cadaveric Human Acellular Dermal Tissue

facility.name: Morgenstern Center for Orbital and Facial Plastic Surgery

clinical_study.official_title: Use of Non-Cadaveric Human Acellular Dermal Tissue (BellaDerm®) in Lower Eyelid Retraction Repair

other_outcome.description: Pre and post operative margin reflex distance 2 (MRD2) and inferior scleral show (ISS) where measured for each eyelid elevation and decrease in inferior scleral show.

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Pre and postoperative margin reflex distance 2 (MRD2) and inferior scleral show (ISS) was measured of each eyelid, and success was defined as a positive eyelid elevation and decrease in inferior scleral show. Long- term stability beyond 12 months was evaluated.
primary_outcome.measure: Pre and Post operative margin reflex distance 2 MRD 2

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
